content.en: EVs in Microgrids: Researchers have been investigating the potential impact of plug-in hybrid electric vehicles (PHEVs) on the planning and operation of smart microgrids. They have found that algorithms can be used to manage the charging and discharging of PHEVs, increasing the penetration of renewable energy and improving the load factor of the power system. By optimizing the operation of microgrids and considering the charging demand of PHEVs, algorithms can also increase self-consumption of solar power, reduce peak demand, and provide regulation service reserves. These findings highlight the role of algorithms in integrating electric vehicles into microgrids, improving energy scheduling, reducing costs, and mitigating the fluctuation of renewable energy generation.
content.da: Elbiler i mikronet: Forskere har undersøgt den potentielle indvirkning af plug-in hybrid-elbiler (PHEV'er) på planlægningen og driften af smarte mikronet. De har fundet ud af, at algoritmer kan bruges til at styre opladning og afladning af PHEV'er, hvilket øger integrationen af vedvarende energi og forbedrer belastningsfaktoren i elsystemet. Ved at optimere driften af mikronet og tage hensyn til opladningsbehovet for PHEV'er, kan algoritmer også øge selvforbruget af solenergi, reducere spidsbelastningen og yde reguleringstjenestereserver. Disse resultater fremhæver algoritmernes rolle i at integrere elbiler i mikronet, forbedre energiplanlægningen, reducere omkostningerne og afbøde svingningerne i produktionen af vedvarende energi.
